HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Use the attached screen for all links to the eAssessment reporting pages until we release an MVP version of reporting. Should only be seen by Beta customers, not LinkIt customers.

Access is from Reports links on the dashboard and primary nav dropdown on BU and the Reports icon in the subway nav on grading screens.

Make reports button on dashboard launch into reporting coming soon page if eassement sku in the feature list
Take me back button takes you back to previous screen
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Coming Soon Screen

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
The code for this is X58691 and the images for the dashboard and fly-in product menu are attached.

The name that should appear beneath the dashboard icon and in the fly-in menu is "Beta Reports"

Please see the attached pdfs for more details.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Beta Reports eApp

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Includes the following dropdown menu options depending on the role/permissions of the user: 
    • Program/Product: BEC admin 
    • State: BEC admin 
    • District: BEC admin 
    • Subdistrict: BEC admin, district admin 
    • School: BEC admin, district admin, school admin (MVP) 
    • Grade: BEC admin, district admin, school admin 
    • Teacher: BEC admin, district admin, school admin 
    • Class: BEC admin, district admin, school admin, teacher (MVP) 
    • Student: BEC admin, district admin, school admin, teacher (MVP) 
  • Options for these dropdowns are based on the following context: 
    • Permissions of the user, so users will only be able to see options that they can select from. In general, teachers and school admins will select from class and student; while district admins will be able to choose from school, class, and student 
    • What test data is available—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels than those selections should not appear 
    • What district terms data is available for—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels for the selected district term than those selections should not appear 
  • The dropdowns work as a hierarchy where options are only displayed once a selection has been made on the level above. Here's examples by role and context: 
    • Teacher accessing reporting from dashboard Reports icon:  
      • Universal selector will only open if the user selects one of the tabs to make a change 
      • Data displayed in the report shown will default to showing class level data for all tests taken within the current district term 
      • If the user wants to make changes to the data being shown and selects the Student tab, the following will display: 
        • Class will display first class in alpha order for that teacher. When clicked, the dropdown will display the class options available. 
          • If there is only one class for a teacher, this dropdown option will not appear 
        • All will be displayed until the user clicks on this dropdown menu. Once clicked, the list of students for the class selected above will display. 
          • If the teacher changes classes, then this dropdown, once clicked, would display the student list for that class 
    • Teacher accessing reporting from link in the grading header: 
      • Class will default to the one that aligns with the group of students included in the test the teacher was grading 
      • Test will default to the one they were grading instead of showing all test taken on the district term 
    • School admin accessing reporting from dashboard Reports icon: 
      • Only change from teacher version above is they will default to the first class in the alpha list of classes available for their school 
    • District admin accessing reporting from dashboard Reports icon: 
      • Only change from above is they will default to the first school in the alpha list of schools available in their district, and the first alpha class available for that school 

Endpoints to be implmented

See attached design and wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1

Expected if data points not available then the entity should not show up
If collective does not have data do not send from back end

Date is a start end date for the selected students in my class.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: [Continued] Reporting: Universal Selector-- Context

  • Options for these dropdowns are based on the following context:

    • What test data is available—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels than those selections should not appear 
    • What district terms data is available for—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels for the selected district term than those selections should not appear

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting: Universal Selector--Student Tab Hierarchy & Context
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Includes the following dropdown menu options depending on the role/permissions of the user: 
    • Program/Product: BEC admin 
    • State: BEC admin 
    • District: BEC admin 
    • Subdistrict: BEC admin, district admin 
    • School: BEC admin, district admin, school admin (MVP) 
    • Grade: BEC admin, district admin, school admin 
    • Teacher: BEC admin, district admin, school admin 
    • Class: BEC admin, district admin, school admin, teacher (MVP) 
    • Student: BEC admin, district admin, school admin, teacher (MVP) 
  • Options for these dropdowns are based on the following context: 
    • Permissions of the user, so users will only be able to see options that they can select from. In general, teachers and school admins will select from class and student; while district admins will be able to choose from school, class, and student 
    • What test data is available—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels than those selections should not appear 
    • What district terms data is available for—if there is no test data available at school, class, and student levels for the selected district term than those selections should not appear 
  • The dropdowns work as a hierarchy where options are only displayed once a selection has been made on the level above. Here's examples by role and context: 
    • Teacher accessing reporting from dashboard Reports icon:  
      • Universal selector will only open if the user selects one of the tabs to make a change 
      • Data displayed in the report shown will default to showing class level data for all tests taken within the current district term 
      • If the user wants to make changes to the data being shown and selects the Student tab, the following will display: 
        • Class will display first class in alpha order for that teacher. When clicked, the dropdown will display the class options available. 
          • If there is only one class for a teacher, this dropdown option will not appear 
        • All will be displayed until the user clicks on this dropdown menu. Once clicked, the list of students for the class selected above will display. 
          • If the teacher changes classes, then this dropdown, once clicked, would display the student list for that class 
    • Teacher accessing reporting from link in the grading header: 
      • Class will default to the one that aligns with the group of students included in the test the teacher was grading 
      • Test will default to the one they were grading instead of showing all test taken on the district term 
    • School admin accessing reporting from dashboard Reports icon: 
      • Only change from teacher version above is they will default to the first class in the alpha list of classes available for their school

HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Student Tab Hierarchy & Context

Task.refObjectName: Set up location for updating Apply filter query conditions Redux
Filter out list users Via availablle instances
Set up Student Menu Component

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Tabs labelled as follows: 
    • Arrows: if clicked opens Top tab below. Arrows indicate open/close. 
    • Student: allows selection of school, class, and student dependent on role 
    • Test: shows list of all relevant tests and allows selection of an individual test 
    • Date: allows selection of district term to be viewed 
  • Tabs are located on the left side of the screen throughout the reporting environment unless otherwise noted for individual reports 
  • Tabs highlight in light blue when hovered over and have the following tool tips: 
    • Student: Select Student 
    • Test: Select Test 
    • Date: Select Date 
  • When selected, tab becomes dark blue and enlarges, menu flys out from left and overlays whatever is being displayed on the screen. 
    • No other controls on the page are active until the fly-out selector is closed.  
    • Selector modal closes by selecting either Apply Filters, Cancel, clicking on the active tab, or clicking outside of the fly-in modal 
    • User can switch between tabs, but changes they made on a tab will not be saved or processed unless they click Apply Filters button on that tab 
    • User must click Apply Filters in order to display the data for the selections made in the flyout menu as well as updating the context header. 
    • Dropdown lists are activated by clicking anywhere in the display field and/or on the caret  
Menu buttons are always squared

See attached for design and link for wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Fly-in Menu Behavior

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting: Universal Selector--Student Tab Dropdown List Behavior
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Choices within the dropdowns are in alphabetic order for School and Class. Student list is alphabetic by last name. 
  • Highlighting & selecting options 
    • Hovering over options in the dropdown lists highlights them in gray even after one is selected 
    • Clicking on a selection from the list closes the list and displays the selection in the closed dropdown menu 
    • If user opens the menu again, the selected item will appear at the top of the list being displayed even if it is not near the top of the list. User will be able to scroll up or down the list from the selected option once it is opened—the option selected still appears in alpha order in the list.  
    • Any selected option will be highlighted in gray when dropdown list is opened.  
    • User can only make one selection at a time from each list 
  • Search 
    • When any dropdown menu is clicked, a search bar appears at the top of the dropdown list. Search is full-text search and returns any results that match what's being typed in and displays them as options to select from below the search bar 
      • For dropdown menus where a selection has been made at the level above, the search bar will appear at the top of the pre-loaded list for that context and the search will filter the list that can be selected 
      • For dropdown menu where no selection has been made at the level above, search will generate the list of options for the user to choose from 
        • This can be a slow search that fills in the options as they are returned 
      • The search bar is not part of the scrollable list of options displayed
      • Active search bar will include a cancel X to cancel the search criteria--see test tab measurement file below for Active search UI. Please apply active search to this tab as well keeping measurements as outlined for the student tab.
  • "All" selection  
    • For MVP, only the student list will have this option. This allows the user to move up a level in the reporting to only look at class-level data after they've selected an individual student 
      • Student list will show "All" until the user selects a single student. 
      • When Student dropdown list is selected, "All" option will continue to appear in the display area for that dropdown until another option is selected and the dropdown closes and displays the new selection 
      • When a student is selected and the dropdown is opened, All appears as the first option below the search bar in the dropdown. If selected the dropdown closes with All appearing as the selection. 
      • All option is locked in position (like the search bar) at the top of the dropdown list. It does not scroll as the rest of the list of students scrolls, so it is always available to choose 
    • In the future we will have the All option for other levels in the hierarchy as well based on roles 
See attached design and wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1

Show a loading ui--will be addressed in a separate user story
Fuzzy search - Matches any text that matches
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Student Tab Dropdown List Behavior

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Design & Behavior
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Default is to display all tests that have completed grading based on the context established on the other selector tabs 
  • Displays table with the following categories 
    • All: checkbox that allows for selection of all tests  
    • Name: displays the test name 
    • Number of Results: displays number of tests with completed grading based on the context (Class/Student and District Term) 
    • Earliest Date: Lists earliest date test was submitted based on context 
    • Latest Date: Lists latest date test was submitted based on context 
      • If context is a single student, then earliest and latest date would be the same  
  • List behavior 
    • All information for a test in the list will highlight in gray as user hovers over them 
    • A single or multiple tests are selected by clicking anywhere on the line for those tests and the checkbox becomes active
      • Single tests are deselected by clicking again on the highlighted test so the checkbox goes back to inactive state 
    • When the test tab is opened, the first selected test in the list should appear at the top of the display area. Users will scroll from here to view the rest of the list based on the sorting options selected
  • Tool tip labels 
    • Box next to Name: Select All Tests 
    • Name: Test Name 
    • Number of Results: Number of Test Results Available 
    • Earliest Date: Earliest Submission Date 
    • Latest Date: Latest Submission Date 
    • Sorting arrows: 
      • Name up arrow: A-Z 
      • Name down arrow: Z-A 
      • Results up arrow: 1-10 
      • Results down arrow: 10-1 
      • Date up arrows: oldest to newest  
      • Date down arrows: newest to oldest 
See attached for design and wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Design & Behavior

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Sorting & Selecting
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Sorting 
    • Name, Number of Results, Earliest Date, and Latest Date all have sorting arrows 
    • Clicking on up arrow sorts in ascending order (A-Z, 1-10, oldest date to newest date) 
    • Clicking on down arrow sorts descending order (Z-A, 10-1, newest date to oldest date) 
    • Selected sorting column header is underlined in green and arrow indicating ascending/descending selection also turns green  
    • Default is to sort list by Earliest Date descending (most recent test at the top descending to the oldest test) 
  • Selecting Single Test, Multiple Tests, or All Tests 
    • Default is all tests in list checked along with the "All" checkbox that appears next to the Name field
    • User can select a single test or multiple tests in the following ways:
      • If no tests are selected, click on the name or checkbox for each test you want selected, or click on the "All" checkbox to select all the tests on the list
      • For tests already selected, user can click individual tests to deselect them or deselect the "All" button to deselect all tests on the list. 
See attached design and wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Sorting & Selecting

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Search Bar and Total
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Search Bar
  • At top of test tab, include a search bar so users can locate the test they are looking for easily
  • Full text search on test name field only
  • Results are based on context from all tabs
  • Test names returned should be listed based on the sorting selections made by the user
  • User begins search by typing in the search bar--see design attached for active mode
    • Cancel X appears at the right end of the search bar to allow user to cancel search
    • Returns all matching text from the test names in list form
    • User hovers and selects tests from this list in the same way as without a search
    • Once test(s) are selected, the search is removed and the first alpha by name test selected is displayed in the list (but remains in the same order on the list overall)
    • Deactivate the all check box
Test Totals
  • In the upper right corner of the test tab, include the number of tests available based on the current context
  • For instance if context is for a single class or student, the total number of tests listed will only be the universe of tests for which test data is available in the District Term selected.
  • Using search will not impact the number of total tests available based on the context
  • Loading icon appears next to this--see loading story and attached design
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Test Tab Search Bar and Total

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Default is current district term 
    • If there is no data for the current district term, but there is data for past district terms, the default will be to display data for the most recent district term available and for the first alpha student in the class for which data is available
    • Historic data can be displayed at the student level, but not at the class level.
  • If there is data for only one district term, no dropdown menu will be available. Just display the district term name
  • If there are other district terms available based on the context of the other selections, dropdown will appear with the current option highlighted in gray
  • Only one district term can be selected at a time 
  • Follows same behavior rules for dropdown as Student Tab
    • There will not be a search bar for this dropdown
    • Loading circle next to label will spin to indicate when data is being processed
See attached for design and wireframe: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=scores-thomas&c=1
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Date Tab

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a user,
I want to know when data is being processed on the universal selector 
so if it takes time for information to appear on the screen I know from the UI that it is processing info and not just frozen.

AC:
  • Circular arrow icon will appear next to School, Class, and Student options on the student tab as shown in design attached below.
  • On the date tab, should appear next to the District Term label using the same specs as on student tab.
  • On the test tab, will appear next to the Number of Tests listing in the upper right corner as indicated in the attached design
  • Icon will only appear when a tab is open and there is data loading for that field/tab. 
  • If there's no data loading, then the icon doesn't appear
  • Icon is available from Google materials
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Selector--Loading Icon

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher,
I need an easy way to navigate between the different levels of reports,
so I can quickly find the information I need.

AC
  • Subway nav appears at the top of the reporting environment and is consistent with the nav from grading
    • We will be adding additional icons to the nav in the future: grade, school, district
  • Allows users to easily switch the context of the report they are viewing between an individual student and the whole class
    • Default for student view is the first alpha student by last name in the class showing all tests for the current district term
    • Default for class view is showing all tests for the current district term
    • Any changes to the context made by the user via the universal selector overrides these defaults
  • See link for design:
    • Enabled/disabled states
    • Breakpoint sizing
Prototype: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1

Design specs: https://benchmarkeducation1-my.sharepoint.com/personal/ggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com/_layouts/15/onedrive.aspx?slrid=437a839e-d0d6-6000-3fd0-a9595c9921ee&id=%2Fpersonal%2Fggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com%2FDocuments%2FUI%20Kit%2FReporting%2FMeasurements%2FReporting_Universal%20Subway_MVP%2Epdf&parent=%2Fpersonal%2Fggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com%2FDocuments%2FUI%20Kit%2FReporting%2FMeasurements
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Header--Subway Navigation

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a user,
I need to be able to switch between types of reports
so I can easily find the information I need to help students.

AC
  • Located beneath the subway nav, these tabs allow users to switch the context from standards to test scores reporting
    • We will be adding additional tabs to this bar in the future: Dashboard, Single Test
  • See link for design specs on enabled/disabled states and breakpoints
Design specs: https://benchmarkeducation1-my.sharepoint.com/personal/ggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com/_layouts/15/onedrive.aspx?slrid=437a839e-d0d6-6000-3fd0-a9595c9921ee&id=%2Fpersonal%2Fggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com%2FDocuments%2FUI%20Kit%2FReporting%2FMeasurements%2FReporting_Universal%20Header%2Epdf&parent=%2Fpersonal%2Fggiordano_benchmarkeducation_com%2FDocuments%2FUI%20Kit%2FReporting%2FMeasurements

Prototype: https://toaqe6.axshare.com/#g=1&p=strands&c=1
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Universal Header--Tabs

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Reporting - Update reporting to launch with a context
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
I want to pass information into reporting to help determine what fitlers i shoulld see and what it should be populated with.

- School
- Class 
- Test

AC:

HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting - Update reporting to launch with a context

Task.refObjectName: update launch

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a [USER], I [ DESCRIBE WHAT THE USER EXPECT].

AC:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Create a Bec D3 Library

Task.refObjectName: Create Base D3 class
Think of Library architecture

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: [Continued] Reporting: Class View--Class Percent Correct Row
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
• Class Percent Correct Row 
    • Displays calculation of ((points scored/points available) x 100) for all students who have complete scores available on the test (first percentage listed) as well as for each individual question on the test.  
      • These scores will be recalculated as teachers shares scores with students via the Share with Students page within the grading environment 
      • Student names and scoring data will not appear on this list until the teacher has shared the graded test with the student 
  • Display of the rest of the information on this page should not wait for the class percent calculations to load—it's fine if this info fills in as it becomes available 
    • While these values are loading a hyphen should appear in the space for the number until it is ready to be displayed 
  • Hovering over Class Percent Correct label will display tool tip with "Based on [number] results" 
    • Results here refers to the number of total tests that were taken in the district term to calculate the percentages displayed here. 
  • If no data available display empty view with some text
  • Updates shown data based on question bar pagination
Backend uses sql query to generate percentages. This is done based on student receiving scores from teacher.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: [Continued] Reporting: Class View--Class Percent Correct Row

Task.refObjectName: create SQL query to aggregate averages
Implement action to fetch class averages
Create apollo endpoint for assignment averages
Create microservice in shared frontend logic to connect to assignment average endpoint

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Pick up design and functionality from the grading version of the student view. The stories relating to the reporting version of this page will focus on the differences between this and the grading version.  

Question Row 
  • No Needs to be Graded exclamation icons will be needed for reporting—all grading is complete for student test to appear here
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Student View--Question Row

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Pick up design and functionality from the grading version of the student view. The stories relating to the reporting version of this page will focus on the differences between this and the grading version. 

Prerequisite: Class view Percent bar is completed.
  • Class Percent Correct Row 
    • Add this row below Question Row as it appears in the class view 
    • Displays calculation of ((points scored/points available) x 100) for all students who have complete scores available on the test (first percentage listed) as well as for each individual question on the test.  
      • These scores will be recalculated as teachers shares scores with students via the Share with Students page within the grading environment 
      • Student names and scoring data will not appear on this list until the teacher has shared the graded test with the student 
    • Display of the rest of the information on this page should not wait for the class percent calculations to load—it's fine if this info fills in as it becomes available 
      • While these values are loading a hyphen should appear in the space for the number until it is ready to be displayed 
    • Hovering over Class Percent Correct label will display tool tip with "Based on [number] results" 
      • Results here refers to the number of total tests that were taken in the district term to calculate the percentages displayed here.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Student View--Class Percent Row

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Pick up design and functionality from the grading version of the student view. The stories relating to the reporting version of this page will focus on the differences between this and the grading version.  

Prerequisite: Class View student list is completed

Student List  
  • Will only display percent or raw score next to student name—no status, needs to be graded, or comment icons appear 
  • Displays all student names (first then last) in alpha order by last name. Display as much of the student name as possible followed by an ellipsis if needed 
  • Hovering over student name will show complete name. 
  • To left of student name display the individual percent correct score or raw score for the test being reviewed using the achievement level color bands  
    • Toggle switch will allow user to switch between percent score (default) and raw score being displayed for each student 
    • Tool tip for score box will say "Percent Score" or "Raw Score" depending on the toggle switch setting 
    • Raw score displayed as total points scored on the test / total points available on the test: 24/32 
  • Pagination for the student list will function in the same way as defined for the Student View in grading
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Student View--Student List

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Pick up design and functionality from the grading version of the student view. The stories relating to the reporting version of this page will focus on the differences between this and the grading version.  

Item Display 
  • Remove comment icon from all questions 
  • Remove revision history dropdown from open response question header 
  • Display graded items as shown in Student Review version of test 
  • Include pop-up Key from grading version along with footer
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Reporting: Student View--Item Display

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Single Test Score - display as raw score and percentage
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher, I want the option to see scores on a single test displayed as either raw score (points earned over total points possible, e.g. 15/35) or a percentage ((points earned/total points possible) x 100, e.g. 43%)) so that it corresponds to how I record and maintain student records.

Applies to all student scores on a single test.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Single Test Score - display as raw score and percentage

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Single Test Scores - aggregated for group
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher, I want to see scores for a single test aggregated for all students in a group who took the test so that I can track performance of that group.

Prerequisite is class view stories are done

Group in this case is either an established group of students within a class as defined in Manage Students, or (in the future) a group of students from different classes as defined in Manage Students.

Dropdown contains list of classes and list of groups for current term. upon selection fetch based off of user ids
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Single Test Scores - aggregated for group

HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher and administrator, I want the ability to filter reporting data by series-specific test type (e.g., for BA, interim, unit, weekly, performance task) so that I can weigh the value of the data differently depending on my need for information.

For example, interim tests may be looked at more closely as a summative test to judge overall progress; whereas weekly and unit tests will be looked at closely as formative tests to inform instruction and intervene if reteaching is necessary.

Ac: 
 Send list of sku to bubba to retrieve program component information
Front microservice caches and store 
Sdk Entity and Bec Model created / modfied
Reporting dropdown containing list of test type to filter by
UI gets filtered based on selected value/s
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Filter by test type
